commits.message: Use upstream wasmtime
Fix C compile warnings in wasm.c

Use ISO C and C++ conformant name: _fdopen on windows

Fixes
```
warning: In file included from src\lib.c:12:
warning: src/./parser.c:1781:28: warning: 'fdopen' is deprecated: The POSIX name for this item is deprecated. Instead, use the ISO C and C++ conformant name: _fdopen. See online help for details. [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
warning:     self->dot_graph_file = fdopen(fd, "a");
warning:                            ^
warning: C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.19041.0\ucrt\stdio.h:2431:28: note: 'fdopen' has been explicitly marked deprecated here
warning:         _Check_return_     _CRT_NONSTDC_DEPRECATE(_fdopen)    _ACRTIMP FILE* __cdecl fdopen(_In_ int _FileHandle, _In_z_ char const* _Format);
warning:                            ^
warning: C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.19041.0\ucrt\corecrt.h:414:50: note: expanded from macro '_CRT_NONSTDC_DEPRECATE'
warning:         #define _CRT_NONSTDC_DEPRECATE(_NewName) _CRT_DEPRECATE_TEXT(             \
warning:                                                  ^
warning: C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Preview\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.29.30133\include\vcruntime.h:310:47: note: expanded from macro '_CRT_DEPRECATE_TEXT'
warning: #define _CRT_DEPRECATE_TEXT(_Text) __declspec(deprecated(_Text))
```

Mark stack__iter as static

Fixes
```
warning: In file included from src\lib.c:14:
warning: src/./stack.c:311:9: warning: static function 'ts_stack__add_slice' is used in an inline function with external linkage [-Wstatic-in-inline]
warning:         ts_stack__add_slice(
warning:         ^
warning: src/./stack.c:274:1: note: use 'static' to give inline function 'stack__iter' internal linkage
warning: inline StackSliceArray stack__iter(Stack *self, StackVersion version,
warning: ^
warning: static
warning: src/./stack.c:15:16: note: expanded from macro 'inline'
warning: #define inline __forceinline
warning:                ^
warning: src/./stack.c:258:13: note: 'ts_stack__add_slice' declared here
warning: static void ts_stack__add_slice(Stack *self, StackVersion original_version,
warning:             ^
warning: 1 warning generated.
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 2.01s
```
fix(cli): Racing on playground webserver port binding

fix(cli): Racing on playground webserver port binding
Fix permanent rebuild triggering in a git worktree due to wrong git branch file path
fix: possible rollover of nanoseconds in clock.h

Added working commands for Windows users

Windows users are likely to be using either Windows Terminal (which uses PowerShell) or PowerShell directly.
Merge pull request #653 from ahelwer:patch-1

cli: Fix build.rs in case of the current branch ref was packed

Support SHA lookup in .git/packed-refs

Various updates to Creating Parsers docs

* Documented test separator suffixes
* Documented partial precedences field
* Added external scanning to conflicting tokens rules
* Added earliest starting position to conflicting tokens rules
* Added note about lexical precedence vs. parse precedence
* Added note about tree-sitter calling external scanner with all
  tokens marked valid during error recovery

Added additional documentation details

* External scanners and infinite loops
* Terminal keywords in externals array
* Using error sentinel external token
* Good practice to erase state variables in deserialize func
* Emphasize external scanner is called first
Merge pull request #1612 from tlaplus-community/update-creating-parser-docs
Fix wasm tests
Bump Emscripten version to 3.1.29

Fix wasm tests and bump Emscripten version to 3.1.29
Update CI action versions

Merge pull request #2015 from tree-sitter/update-ci-action-versions

Update CI action versions
Remove unused no-minimize arg for the generate command
cli: add -b, --build flags for `tree-sitter generate`

loader: add TREE_SITTER_LIBDIR; cli: add --libdir to `tree-sitter generate`

Closes #1336

comment.body: I think this should be an **and**, not an **or**. To be counted, a node must be within the supplied byte range **and** within any supplied point range.

issue.title: Overflow uint32_t when parsing a large source file that exceeds a length of 4GB
issue.body:
# Description

The tree-sitter code uses uint32_t to store lengths.

Ex: [TSInput::read, api.h](https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/blob/master/lib/include/tree_sitter/api.h#L74)


This implementation may result in an overflow bug when parsing large files, leading to parsing failures. While this is typically not an issue for most source code files, as they generally do not exceed 4GB in size.It can be problematic for formatted text files used for application input/output, such as JSON, XML, and DOT files. These files can sometimes be very large in size, which can lead to unexpected errors.

# How to reproduce

1. Use a parser

    ```
    git clone https://github.com/rydesun/tree-sitter-dot.git
    cd tree-sitter-dot
    cargo build
    ```

2. Utilize tree-sitter to parse a large .dot file(> 4GB)
      ```
      tree-sitter parse  [LARGE_DOT_FILE] -d
      ```
We hope to parse it without any issues for the .dot file is OK, but unfortunately, it is giving an error.

# How to fix it

A simple and quick fix could be achieved by [changing all length-related variables to uint64_t type](https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/compare/master...scuptio:tree-sitter:master)(I haven't thoroughly tested all functionalities and verified whether they work correctly, but it does resolve the overflow issue).

forkee.name: tree-sitter
forkee.description: An incremental parsing system for programming tools

issue.title: Helpful parser error messages
issue.body:
I can't seem to figure out a way to surface parser errors to the user of my text editor. In particular, I'm working on a VSCode extension using tree-sitter to parse typescript files and surface parsing errors. Tree-sitter is much faster than the typescript language service, so far, but I can't seem to figure out how to surface a useful error message to the user.

In particular, I'd like something like the `Parsing error: ';' expected.` that eslint gives me. I figure that tree-sitter has some sort of context on the active branches in the parser, so should be able to surface that context in the error object.

If this feature already exists, and I'm just missing something, perhaps it should be included in the documentation site, as I couldn't find anything there.

comment.body:
One workable approach could be storing a parser-state(s?) in MISSING nodes, and augmenting table generator with info such as named nonterminals + terminals that are valid to be shifted into that state(s). Together with inspecting the node's parent, I think that would be workable information to produce good errors.

New to the project, however, so hard for me to determine how feasible that idea is. Should I take a crack at an implementation, or would I waste my time?

forkee.name: tree-sitter
